pages.title: AWS Certified Developer - Associate
pages.description: This badge certifies that I am knowledgeable about dev-related AWS Services and their best practices. As someone who used to self-host sites on a Raspberry Pi with Docker Swarm, I have a deep appreciation for the simplification of app deployment, development, and security with AWS. With my newly acquired skills, this portfolio site was deployed in AWS with an ALB and ECS Fargate. In terms of difficulty, this is an intermediate certificate: one step above an AWS Cloud Practitioner.

pages.title: Full Stack Developer
pages.description: In this role, I provided direct consultation for various clients from small businesses to mid-sized corporations across industries such as shipping, medicine, and banking. Specifically, I have built SharePoint intranets, Azure functions, Microsoft Flows, a custom web app to work around an Azure limitation, and the frontend base (React/Redux) of Synergy's proprietary ticketing system. In addition, I maintained Azure functions, React sites, C# Web Site projects, and MSSQL Server databases.

pages.title: SEC EDGAR Rust API
pages.description: A small library for querying the SEC's EDGAR written in Rust. This was the first time I ever created a production-level open-source library intended for public use. It's original purpose was to support my personal stock trading bot. I had a great experience learning Rust and I'd like to continue using it in the future.

pages.title: Application Support Analyst
pages.description: My primary role was to write PL/SQL scripts to implement custom app configurations for clients using MHK's proprietary healthcare platform. Upon revealing my skills in automated testing using Selenium and Python, I was put in charge of setting up best practices in Jira on top of my normal responsibilities. Other laudable achievements include producing the companyâ€™s platform software installation with no prior experience nor help, writing and distributing python scripts to automate work, and automating bug reports to clients.

pages.title: Project Skill Tree
pages.description: An MVP of an SPA where teachers can create skill trees for students. The application is not complete. When it comes to making education more student-centered, I believe a step in the right direction is to make it a more fun game to play through the use of skill trees.

pages.title: Portfolio/Blog site version 3
pages.description: My final portfolio site built with technologies that I believe will stand the test of time: HTMX and Rust. I thoroughly enjoyed building this project with the comfort knowing that if I ever need to extend functionality of this site, I can always do so with HTMX. I call it the HAAx framework: HTMX for API calls, Askama for HTML templating, and Axum for a Rust API. This site was my first deployment in AWS using an ALB and ECS Fargate.

pages.title: Portfolio/Blog site version 2
pages.description: My old portfolio website. I built this with Deno and their new JS framework called Fresh. The concepts I learned while using Fresh did in fact help me land my first tech job. This is because Fresh was so new that it did not have the simplified abstractions that React had so I had to figure out more of the JavaScript myself.

pages.title: Portfolio/Blog Site version 1
pages.description: My first portfolio site. This site is no longer up because Gatsby ended their free cloud tier. This project was built with Gatsby static site generator.

pages.title: Project Semblance
pages.description: The purpose of this project was to encourage people to meet others locally, in-person through the gamification of story archetypes and narrative choices. Although I learned a lot, I am no longer interested in completing this project.

pages.title: breadsauce
pages.description: So I actually did get married and I plan to keep that way. I used this opportunity to build my own wedding site. I wanted to create a personal website that showcased my animation skills as well as try new tech like the Vite bundler. Vite is F-A-S-T.

pages.title: C# Trading Bot
pages.description: A simple trading bot that can handle multiple algorithms at the same time. This was my first foray into the C# language. C# is a very easy language to pick up. It's no wonder why it's so loved and used. Funny story, before I stopped running the bot, I discovered that it made my paper-trading account go up 21%. T_T

pages.title: Simple Lead Generator
pages.description: The purpose of this script is to provide a GUI for scraping emails, phone numbers, and contact urls from the top result of duckduckgo from a list of business names in an excel sheet. The motivation for building this was actually because it was part of a business deal. The deal didn't go through and the Python code for this project is so messy that it makes me embarrassed to call myself a developer. But it works and I love it. 10/10 experience, I'd do it again.
